intro: Chorizanthe parryi var. parryi, commonly known as Parry's wild millet, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces distinctive, triangular seeds that are often dispersed by wind. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems and a subject of study in plant ecology.
